thread.title: SEC Softball Tournament weather updates: Thursday's games delayed by weather
thread.title_full: SEC Softball Tournament weather updates: Thursday's games delayed by weather

author: , Florida Today
title: SEC Softball Tournament weather updates: Thursday's games delayed by weather
text:
SEC Softball Tournament weather updates: Thursday's quarterfinals games to begin at 5 p.m. following delay Ehsan Kassim USA TODAY NETWORK The 2024 SEC Softball Tournament was delayed Thursday at Auburn's Jane B. Moore Field due to inclement weather.
The quarterfinal round of the tournament was scheduled to begin at 11 a.m. CT, but the SEC posted on X (formerly known as Twitter) at 10:24 a.m. that it would be going into a rain delay. At 10:55 a.m., the account said they were under an "extended delay . The Tennessee Vols X account called the delay an "indefinite rain delay" and that the next update would come at 1 p.m. CT.
üö® WEATHER UPDATE
As weather proceeds to move through the area, we remain in an extended delay at the 2024 SEC Softball Tournament.
We will continue to provide updates as they become available throughout the day. #SECSB x #SECTourney pic.twitter.com/RMIowFQbw7
‚Äî Southeastern Conference (@SEC) May 9, 2024 LSU-Tennessee will be played at 5 p.m. Thursday, followed by Missouri-Arkansas 35 minutes after the conclusion of that game.
Florida-Georgia will be played at 9 a.m. Friday, with Texas A&M and South Carolina following it up 35 minutes after.Here‚Äôs what you need to know about the SEC softball schedule and the latest updates:
REQUIRED READING: SEC Softball Tournament bracket: Full TV schedule, scores, results for 2024 championship
SEC Tournament softball weather updates 4:08 p.m.: The Tennessee Vols softball social media account posted a picture for sore eyes: A view of the sun. It looks like everything should be on track to get in two softball games in the SEC Tournament tonight. An 3 p.m., the social account tweeted out a video of the players exiting the team bus and getting prepared for the 5 p.m. contest.
Blue skies are here üòç pic.twitter.com/gsTt7dM2ec
‚Äî Tennessee Softball (@Vol_Softball) May 9, 2024 1:05 p.m.: The SEC social media account tweeted out a revised schedule for the quarterfinal. Tennessee-LSU will play at 5 p.m. CT, followed by Missouri-Arkansas 35 minutes following the conclusion of the first game. Florida-Georgia will be moved to Friday morning, with a 9 a.m. first pitch. Texas A&M and South Carolina will play 35 minutes following the conclusion of that one.
üö® WEATHER UPDATE
First pitch for QF1 @LSUsoftball vs. @Vol_Softball will be at 5:02 PM CT, and QF2 @MizzouSoftball vs. @RazorbackSB will follow approx. 35 minutes after. Gates will open at 4:30 PM CT.
QF3 and QF4 have shifted to tomorrow morning. Gates will open at 8:30 AM CT.‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/3kJB3Q8oWu
‚Äî Southeastern Conference (@SEC) May 9, 2024 12:53 p.m.: At 12:50 p.m. CT, the LSU softball account tweeted that the first pitch of the Tennessee-LSU game is now scheduled for 5 p.m. CT. With three other games scheduled behind the quarterfinal opener, it will be interesting to see how the schedule plays out.
üö® SCHEDULE UPDATE üö®
First pitch today against Tennessee will begin at 5 p.m. CT! #DealUsIn pic.twitter.com/FxxVWruQWY
‚Äî LSU Softball (@LSUsoftball) May 9, 2024 12:01 p.m.: The SEC Softball Tournament remains in an "extended weather delay", per the SEC social media account. There are no updates yet about a potential start time.
üö® WEATHER UPDATE
The 2024 SEC Softball Tournament remains in an extended weather delay.
We are actively monitoring the situation and will provide additional updates as they become available. #SECSB x #SECTourney https://t.co/IU8JW6N24N
‚Äî Southeastern Conference (@SEC) May 9, 2024 We are in an indefinite rain delay üåßÔ∏è
The next update will come at 1 pm ET. pic.twitter.com/dlDKGvk5Ey
‚Äî Tennessee Softball (@Vol_Softball) May 9, 2024 SEC softball tournament schedule for quarterfinals The 2024 SEC Tournament got underway Tuesday with No. 13 seed Ole Miss beating No. 12 Kentucky 7-2. Four games were played in the second round Wednesday, including 14-inning victories for 8 seed LSU over 9 seed Alabama and 7 seed Georgia over 10 seed Auburn.
Tennessee, which is the No. 1 overall seed and the defending champion, was scheduled to open the day against LSU at 11 a.m. Here's a look at the rest of the scheduled games for the rest of the day:
Game 6: No. 1 Tennessee vs. No. 8 LSU | 5 p.m. | SEC Network Game 7: No. 4 Arkansas vs. No. 5 Missouri ‚Äì approx. 35 minutes following Game 6 | SEC Network Game 8: No. 2 Florida vs. No. 7 Georgia ‚Äì 9 a.m., Friday | SEC Network Game 9: No. 3 Texas A&M vs. No. 11 South Carolina ‚Äì approx. 35 minutes following Game 8 | SEC Network
The semifinals are scheduled to begin at 4 p.m. Friday, and the championship game is scheduled for 5 p.m. Saturday.
